Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: suzieq50
Reviews.Content: One of the friendliest hotel's I've ever stayed in. Superior staff from check in to check out. We checked in on Friday afternoon - in a whirlwind. Immediately following a horrible thunderstorm. The bellman assisted us with our gear - we were traveling with a baby and had LOTS! We ate in both restaurants -(I went on line to Restaurants.com and bought $25 certificates for $2) swam in the pool, used the inside walkway to the mall. Great weekend. We had adjoining rooms that worked perfectly for our situation. LOVE INDIANAPOLIS!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - well located”
Reviews.Author: TravelManSouth
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice, great workout room, breakfast buffett ok, 5 mins walking distance of everywhere. Well soundproofed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: Located downtown, very convenient to convention center and restaurants. Typical room with no frills, but a larger bathroom than average. Loved the Starbucks in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dated”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Munster
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here and at the JW recently. JW is brand new, this one is slightly dated but not bad. Rooms are smallish. Clean but dated. 3 blocks from city center mall. 6 blocks from Bankers Life FH and Lucas. Lot of restaurants close by and across the street from the convention center. Slightly unhappy that they would not give me a late check out. I'm a gold and would expect more flexibility even when the hotel is full the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, smelly”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: The place needs a good working over. My room was shabby and smelled somewhere between stale cigarette smoke and industrial strength cleaner. Food very average although fairly priced. The whole place felt slightly down at heel.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location in Indy”
Reviews.Author: wendywwBrighton
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Indy and was scheduled there to make a conference presentation. The downtown Marriott was the conference location, so I didn't have to choice from a list, but there are a bunch! In fact, most of them are lined up on the same street with the Marriott I stayed in including a towering JW Marriott, Westin, Hilton, etc. The location was great; although all of the activities I was involved in were self-contained in the hotel, it is connected by a skybridge to other downtown locations including the Convention Center which is directly across the street. The staff was very effiicient and friendly and the rooms were nice. Although it's an older hotel (70's 'ish) the rooms were I saw, including mine, were good-sized and all had been updated with fresh wall coverings, paint, carpeting, bed coverings, furniture and 32" flat panel TVs. I was surprised by how many channels were available on the TV; I find they are usually much more limited. The bathrooms were also very nice and clean and had obviously been updated as well though the floor and bath tile were showing a little age. there are two restaurants off the hotel lobby. One called the "City Grille" is obviously the hotel restaurant. They offered a nice buffet breakfast (typically cheaper than ordering breakfast ala carte, especially since it includes your beverages of choice). We also had lunch there one day and although the food was fine, it was pricey for a sandwich and salad. I'd recommend using the sports bar restaurant, champions, which is off the lobby as well, but appears to be separate from the hotel. They had a nice variety of foods, everything we tried was good, and they were a bit more reasonable price-wise. Dinner at the City Grille is likely to cost you about the same as a dinner at McCormick & Schmicks Steak House, which was only a $5 cab ride away. My only issue was that I discovered when I turned in the first night that my Marriott number had not been applied to my reservation, so they were unaware that I need a down-free room. As soon as I made them aware the next morning, they had housekeeping remove all of the down and replace it with fiber-based products. Although I don't know how it compares to its neighboring hotels, I would definitely be happy staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: HermanG
Reviews.Content: We attended a trade show in February, and the Marriott hotel was a great spot. Right in the heart of downtown. It has a direct walkway into the convention center, and the rates were priced better than the others. Rooms are updated and feature all the amenities you need.

Reviews.Title: “standard Marriott - pricy but efficient”
Reviews.Author: andrewv45
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, good breakfast, busy lobby, close to central downtown. and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: denonno
Reviews.Content: This Marriott had the smallest rooms ever! The place was spotless and well kept, however being 4 people in a double/double room we were on top of each other. The location was excellent because you could walk to restaurants, shopping and bars. The hotel had a great sports bar as well. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The walls were paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: RGD64
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure here, I booked this room through Priceline for $67/night. I was in town to attend the NFL Experience preceding the Super Bowl. The hotel does not offer airport shuttle service but the Indy Go green line will deliver you to a stop directly across the street from the hotel for $7 one way. Upon arrival I learned the New York Giants were staying at the hotel. This provided for celebrity viewing but was well handled by the hotel and security staffs. It did not cause any problem for hotel guests that I could tell. Check in was very smooth and fast. The front desk staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. I stayed on a 7th floor room with a view of the alley behind the hotel. I did see a view of Lucas Oil Stadium at the very edge of the window. The room was nicely sized with two double beds. Plenty of room to walk around with two people in the room. The bathroom was nice sized and very clean. This was the cleanest hotel room I have stayed in in awhile. The hotel is connected to the convention center by sky walk and can be accessed without going outdoors. I ate at both restaurants in the hotel. both were over priced with average to good food. I had a great stay at this Marriott. It is centrally located for all downtown Indianapolis activities, very clean and comfortable. My biggest complaint is the food prices. This is not a problem however as there are dozens of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Odd policy”
Reviews.Author: IndianaWander
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful location, fantastic facility, and superior staff! I just can't understand one policy: When booking, the Marriott will not guarantee the number of beds in the room. It could be a double queen or a king! I travel often and have never been unable to have a guaranteed room type before. Four friends will NOT fit in a king bed, but they will fit in two queen beds. It wasn't a problem, but it was a worry. The staff said it was because they operate on a first-come, first-served basis. Still from the basis of customer service, I want to know that I am guaranteed a certain type of room AND that I don't need to beat someone there to get that particular room. It is an absolutely wonderful place, but I would like someone to explain what the Marriott gains by operating with this philosophy.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay just as great as the first!”
Reviews.Author: GFTravels
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Marriott in the last six months. We booked the room through Priceline and got a great deal despite it being the first weekend of pre-Super Bowl activities in Indy. For attending those activities, the location could not be better! Right across from the Maryland Street leg of the Convention Center and just half a block from the zip lines and activities on Capital, we were in the heart of everything just half a block away. The valets at the Marriott were so cordial and up front about valet vs. self-parking in the garage under the hotel. Valets at some hotels lose interest in you if you decide to park yourself, but these guys were very nice, helpful with directions, and also very welcoming each time we went in or out of the hotel. The elevator from the parking garage goes straight up to the end of the hotel lobby--very convenient. When it came to checking in, Alex at the front desk could not have been nicer, answering my questions about a possibly extending our stay (we didn't but only because one evening of the Super Bowl stuff was enough) and arranging a late check out for us. We asked for a room at the end of the hall with a king sized bed--and that's what we got. Great view of the State Capital, too. The room was a standard King room and not overly large, but certainly big enough. The large flatscreen had a wide selection of channels, including HBO. Having a refrigerator would have been nice (we did not use the minibar). Although there was a national sorority convention at the hotel, we had a very peaceful stay and slept quite well (very comfortable bedding!). This is also the first hotel in a L-O-N-G time where we weren't awakened in the morning by hearing "Housekeeping" and tapping on the door of a nearby room. Although the housekeeping staff was working just a few doors down from our room, we weren't aware of them until we were ready to leave and went by the cart. Internet is free in public areas or in the business center (2nd floor). Guests can print 20 pages for free in the business center. The cost for Internet in the room depends on where your provider is located; if it is a local provider the connection fee is $1.00. Otherwise long-distance phone rates apply. We were able to use the business center for about 15 minutes to look up restaurant info, etc. The only negative for me: parking fees are high--$28 to self park for 24 hours and $34 to valet--but that is a city-wide issue in downtown Indy. The toilets in the rooms are also incredibly loud--similar to airplane or cruise ship toilets. The menu for the restaurant on the first floor looked amazing, but we didn't get the chance to try it this time. Definitely plan to next time--and this is a place we will be going back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: dlunz
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for two nights in January for JAMfest Super Nationals cheerleading competition at the Convention Center. EXCELLENT location to the convention center (wish we had known about this hotel the other years we traveled to Indy)! Skywalk from hotel connects right at Hall D in Convention Center. The hotel really took the time to cater to the guests that were there for the cheerleading competition! So many special little touches! Always felt welcomed by all staff at the hotel. Starbucks in the lobby, a plus! Breakfast at the Circle City Bar & Grille was delicious! Dinner at Champions Sports Bar & Grill was fantastic! Wish I lived closer to eat there more often! The walls between rooms and hallways are EXTREMELY thin! You could hear the neighbors talking all the time, which made falling asleep difficult each night. My other complaint is that there is no bathroom fan or fan on the heating/air controls to run all night, which sometimes helps drown out noise from neighboring rooms or the hallway. Would stay here again, but might bring my own fan or machine to help block out the noise/talking from the rooms and hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot get a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: markristin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the employees were exceptional. The walls, ceiling, and doors are very, very thin. You could hear the people in the next room, in the room above, and in the hallway all talking most of the night. The pluming is very noisy from our room and the other rooms. If it were not for the employees, this would not have been a good trip. Everyone was so nice and friendly, especially the valet attendants.

Reviews.Title: “Better inside than it appears from outside”
Reviews.Author: hsipes
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. SO modern and clean. The beds are really comfortable. Location is everything with the Marriott Downtown. You can park your car and walk anywhere you'd ever need to go. Champions restaurant is located inside and is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of the baseball, basketball, American football, mall, restaurants, capitol building, main city circle and easy access from expressway and airport. Typical Marriott so nothing woo-hoo but good solid standard.

Reviews.Title: “Not a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura P
Reviews.Content: It was not a comfortable stay. The room was dusty so, I called the room service. But there is no response, so many times I called. The front desk staff was rude and said that the room service is on the way. After one hour I got my room cleaned. I was extremely disappointed by their approach. The hotel was in nice location but the food they offer was not good. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service!”
Reviews.Author: Lori C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the downtown Marriott after a work holiday party. They blew me away by their service from the valets to the bellmen to the concierge and the front desk. Everyone was really helpful and pleasant. I expected pretty much what you get at other hotels, but was VERY pleasantly surprised. Definitely surpassed my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: homeykat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a cheerleading competition at the Convention Center. I loved the convenience of walking across the skywalk and being at the competition. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. My only complaints were that the walls were thin. I could hear the people on both sides of me talking. Also, I was given a handicapped room, which I didn't request. There was no sink vanity. NONE, there wasn't even anywhere to put the soap. There wasn't a separate area to get ready either.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JeanneK4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night while visiting Indy with our family. The rooms were very clean and updated. The pool and hot tub were great for the kids. Walking distance to shops and restaurants. The only downside is that they do not have free wi-fi in the rooms. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janice1978
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Downtown Marriott. I thought perhaps since the JW had opened, that this hotel would suffer in quality. Boy was I wrong! From the moment we pulled up to the valet to the time valet returned out car we had nothing but great Hoosier Hospitality! Everyone was extremely friendly and willing to do whatever it took to make our stay above average. There was a large H.S. band competition and when we requested a room away from the kids, no problem. We were put on the Concierge Floor in a smallish but very comfortable corner king room. Breakfast and Internet access was excellent in the Concierge Room. Breakfast consisted of fresh fruit, hot & cold cereals, eggs, meat, waffles, yogurt, & great muffins. We had the best sleep we've had away from home in a long time--quiet room and extremely comfortable bed. Yes, parking was pricey, but I think the safety is worth it. Great location and walked everywhere we wanted to go. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: Dezi B
Reviews.Content: From the airport we took a taxi to JW Marriott. Turned out to be the wrong Marriott!!! There seem to be 3 Marriotts all close together. It is easy to get them confused!! After realizing our mistake! No one had our name!! We were directed across the street, which we walked, to the Downtown Marriott. They share a parking garage and a connecting skywalk. There is also a Courtyard Marriott nearby. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The staff very helpful and friendly. Elevators were fast, not much waiting! The rooms clean and comfortable and the food in all of the reataurants was amazingly good. It was cold and rainy so we didn`t want to go out looking for food. They also have a very good Starbucks in the lobby!! We loved that. We did have a good experience there and look forward to returning next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a lot of limitations”
Reviews.Author: jio498
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel but lack of free wi fi when most of the hotels surrounding you have it. heck most of the reasturants surrounding it has it. then the television was confusing to use when you hook up the ps3 then when you did we were limitied at how loud it could go. however if these things are not important for you then yeah it was a wonderfull stay. just a shame another hotel blocked the view of the city. it probably had wifi lol

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: world taster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Downtown Marriott during a convention October 13 through 16. The close proximity to the Convention Center, the enclosed skywalks and the easy access to the nearby mall were all wonderful. In addition the room was terrific. It was a good size with a large bathroom and offered a fridge. The bed was extremely comfortable. The service was A1. We had no complaints and would love another opportunity to stay at this fine establishment. It was particularly helpful to leave the hotel at 5 am and find the promised 24/7 taxi line in place and fully operational. Good job Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Gerri B
Reviews.Content: When we decided at the last minute to take a nice romantic weekend trip to indianapolis, I expected to pay a little bit more...however to end up paying 270 per night ONLY to discover that our deluxe king room is a tiny room with 2 double beds!! Upon speaking to the front desk I was told sorry, no more rooms. There are so many other choices in downtown Indy, so choosing a Marriott, I thought would be a good choice. I was wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room...pricey extras”
Reviews.Author: halekat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a conference. The room was comfortable and clean. It was fairly quiet but not soundproof as the hotel website advertises. Parking was expensive and wifi was not free, which was shocking to me. Since when is wifi not free in a hotel?!? Folks did seem to go out of their way to make sure all needs were met. I'd rather have internet access in my room and forego all the extra people standing around waiting to "serve" me. Even the business center had a fee to use!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know service like this still existed”
Reviews.Author: Mavenhawk
Reviews.Content: Came down on a Sunday for business expecting to leave on Tuesday morning. Came down with a VERY bad case of Strep on Monday morning. They extended my stay for an additional night at the same rate I was paying even though current rates on Expeidia were almost $100 per night more. When I called down to the front desk and asked if someone could please get me some nyquil from the little store. They came to the door with the nyquil and a bowl of Chicken soup with saltines. Seriously what hotel staff has the simple kindness to think ahead and bring someone who feels miserable something that will make them feel better? Everyone I talked to was so kind and considerate. The sweet lady that brought up my room service for lunch told me her hours and to call down and ask for anything that I could think of that would help and she would take care of me. Made me feel like I had an extra mom in the hotel (and I am well past 35 and a very frequent traveler). Thanks to the Marriott hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better places in Indy”
Reviews.Author: Erika T
Reviews.Content: My husband and one-year old and I came for a weekend in Indy. The location of this hotel is fairly accesible to activities in downtown; our room overlooked the baseball stadium. Parking is expensive at the hotel and surrounding areas. I found a meter, (Indy's meters take credit cards!) paid for 4 hours, and my Saturday night/sunday morning parking was free. Bargain! The room was okay- the bathroom tub had rust stains and was very slippery. The bedding was nice and comfortable. I read on TravelAdvisor about a great donut shop and the front desk staff were very helpful in giving me directions. Overall, my stay was okay, but there are better choices in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: noirnevara
Reviews.Content: This is not my first stay at the Downtown Marriott and it will not be my last. The hotel staff was beyond excellent. The room, though small was well appointed and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and had plenty of pillows. My only complaint is that there was only free wi-fi in the lobby, however the staff assured me that they were working to get wi-fi in every room and this should be done by 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient location, wholly acceptable service”
Reviews.Author: BigIrishGod
Reviews.Content: While holding/ attending an event at the nearby convention center this hotel is definitely a no brainer. I have stayed here many times for many different events, but I had never stayed here while the hotel was as packed as it was for the Cappa Alpha Psi 2011 gathering that was taking place the same time as our event. The hotel staff did a remarkably good job at handling such large crowds which I'm sure was helped by the fact that the Cappa Alpha Psi's were class acts all weekend. My room was exactly what I expected from a Marriot property, clean and comfortable. I had no problems all weekend. I did end up enjoying room service one evening. Service was prompt and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and convenient”
Reviews.Author: HowieCanoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night while in town for a festival at Museum of Art. Stayed here 5 years ago and was not impressed, it was tired, service was not the best, they even lost my car keys (thankfully I had a second set) and blamed it on the contracted services and therefore wouldn't help me, or make an offer for my inconvenience. However, this time, a totally different experience. Price was very competitive. They now operate their own parking services, which was very courteous. They remodeled the lobby, very nice. The rooms looked like they were recently remodeled, very nice and comfortable. We had the buffet breakfast, which was better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel dishonest maid”
Reviews.Author: guatamama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a recent conference. Amenities are great. Rooms are clean. Staff is friendly. My only complaint is that I forgot my flat iron in the room when I checked out. Called the hotel back to see if it was in lost in found. Housekeeping had not turned it in as a lost item. Hope that maid enjoys her $80 flat iron. You'll know its her when you see her beautifully straightened hair.

Reviews.Title: “What one would expect from a Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: infinitiboys
Reviews.Content: Check in was very easy. Every staff member we came into contact with was friendly. Room was smallish, but very clean. Very comfortable bed and great water pressure in the shower. Use the mat, because the tub is dangerously slick. Concierge made an excellent recommendation for brunch at patachou on the park. Parking was free on the street for the weekends or $15 in the state building lot on the side of the hotel across Missouri street, so do not pay $28 to park in the hotel garage. Overall a very nice one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Dave T
Reviews.Content: This was a wholey acceptable stop for a business traveler. Clean and quiet. I did not order room service, since Indianapolis has a great restaurant scene downtown. The front desk staff was pleasant. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for Gen Con - PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: davechri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we attended Gen Con (in the convention center). I'm not sure there is a better place to stay. It was outstanding. We had access to the concierge floor for breakfast, dinner, and late-night desserts. We were able to store our luggage before (we arrived before the room was ready) and after our stay. The lounge was nice. And (maybe because we were on the Elite floor) it was really quiet. Just a PERFECT stay. (We stayed for free because we used Marriott Rewards points, so our "Value" was awesome. I was surprised we were able to stay with points during the convention. Great!) It's a 4 Star hotel with 5 Star access to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled like vomit”
Reviews.Author: Cambear2
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked promising, but when you have a late check-in at 2 am, you don't scrutinize too closely. If you're dead tired, you may not be able to actual pinpoint the awful smell as vomit, but the identity of the scent is clear after you've been inhaling it for a while. The staff tried to make up for this with a free breakfast which was laughable as my stomach was so wretched I couldn't eat for hours and ran into the cold winter morning to clear my head. Cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel329
Reviews.Content: i went with my husband on a business trip. there were catered dinners and a "pub" with snacks and games. the staff was just great! so kind and helpful. always had a smile on their face. our room was very nice. clean and comfortable. would definitely recommend to others. and the food was awesome too!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Customer Service, but Issues”
Reviews.Author: kebiewj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Indianapolis Downtown and we were unaware there was a huge convention. Upon arrival we were quickly greeted by the valet and able to breeze through check-in. I had a few issues 1) I called the front desk because there was a party in the ballroom so loud I couldn't sleep. They immediately sent some to our room, they wanted to move us but the hotel was at capacity. They gave me free break buffets and access to the concierge floor. The next morning we didn't have hot water. So the plumber came - he was able to fix in 10 minutes. The next morning we didn't have hot water again - they sent the plumber. It took 2 men approximately 30 minutes. This time they gave me one night free. Good customer service but not my best stay at a Marriott. I'm sure my next stay will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Like Most Others No Complaints Here”
Reviews.Author: kraver
Reviews.Content: Like many others I found this hotel to be quite nice without any real flaws. It is a very big hotel which caters to many convention type guests (the convention centre is just across the street). There is no free internet in the rooms but you can get free Wifi in the common/lobby areas. Within the room there is actually a fridge (kind of hidden in the dresser) which was a surprise. The only major knock I would have against this hotel is the expensive parking (and the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars). Their parking rate ($28/night self parking) was the highest I saw in the area. Downtown Indy parking is expenseive and this seemed to be the most expensive. Location wise it is well situated. If you will be spending more time in the heart of downtown (Circle Centre Mall, etc.) then the Westin and Hyatt are closer, on the other hand the Marriott is closer to the Canal. All in all, nice comfortable stay with no real issues.

Reviews.Title: “Does not guarantee bed type.”
Reviews.Author: Mjv5
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I reserved a king bed room for the Brickyard 400 weekend. While the location was great, we were surprised to received a double bed room at check-in. When we asked for the king we reserved, we were told the hotel 'never guarantees bed type' and that the kings were sold outs had we known, we would have stayed at the Westin instead. Also---we went to the pool to have a quick swim and found the water to be really, really cloudy and gross. Pick another hotel, folks!!

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: fusionorange32
Reviews.Content: From the checkin to the dinner hate to say it but just pure frustration....OUTDATED hotel with nothing but a bunch of upcharges. I have stayed in better hotels with better service recently. Parking rates were unreasonable too, especially self parking $28 a night....come on.., this is Indiana..not New York or somewhere with actual scenery and things to do. Don't forget the $40 a night for incidentals...just in case you do order something, supposed to stay 3 nights only stayed 1!!! Went to a cleaner & more updated hotel with lots of amenities, not to mention they have a parking lot of their own!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: chubbyviking
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Indianapolis Downtown in June. It has a wonderful location. It is only a 4-5 walk block to the center of town and numerous great restaraunts. It is directly across the street from the Convention Center (even connected by skyway), 5 blocks from Lucas Oil Stadium and 2 blocks from Victory Field (AAA baseball). The hotel was very nice and the service was good. However, the rooms were very small and only had 2 double beds, not queen. Also a disappoint was that the swimming pool was drained and being renovated. Overall it was a nice hotel; but not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: pettiebone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriot for a convention. It's nice that it's right across the street from the convention center and it's connected by a breezeway. Service in the hotel restaurants was pretty bad. Also, the hotel does not offer wifi, which I believe is unacceptable for a hotel at this level.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice to Stay”
Reviews.Author: letsgoskating
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when I travel to Indy for business. The staff are very friendly and never keep you waiting. The beds are very comfortable and rooms are clean. It's also within walking distance to plenty of restaurants and having a Starbucks in the lobby is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Decent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurfTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott Downtown recently for a few days during a business meeting held at the hotel. This was my third time staying at this hotel (in fact, only place I've stayed when in Indy). This was the location of the business meeting, as each past visit was, so I didn't choose the hotel myself. Mostly good points about this hotel. Great location, near to convention center, Lucas Oil field, downtown (you can walk nearly anywhere, including Conseco Fieldhouse). Location was great. Interior is nice, no complaints. They have a Starbucks in the lobby (yawn) and another restaurant that I ate lunch at but no dinners (lunches were pretty good, and I heard good things about the dinners there). Service was very good and very nice - typically midwestern. One really nice amenity is that there is a sports bar attached should you be there with a beer-drinking-after-the-meeting crowd (I always have been), which is good since you don't have to go far. And, it's super convenient to the convention center. Complimentary toiletries in bathroom - loved them! Citrusy, really nice. Good HD TV, and nice work desk (is this a place that caters to business crowd?). Great service, friendly staff. So, mostly good. The bad? My god, paying for internet!!!! $12.95 /day or so. When will hotels get over this? Wait, did I previously presume this place caters to business crowd? Why not charge for cable TV, and go back to the days of paying for phone calls? If providing a system for us to use is that big a deal, wrap it into the room cost and we'll all be happy. Note to Marriott and other hotel chains also still clinging to this past practice: we all use internet in our rooms. It's not that big a deal! Charge us a bit extra if you have to, just don't rub my nose in it by making me pay extra. Also, room soundproofing is average at best, but can't blame the hotel on a wingnut arguing with his wife on the phone while others should be sleeping (like, after midnight). The bath towels were strangely thin and coarse - don't recall them like this in other Marriott properties, but I'm a Hilton man usually (nice towels). They were thin, coarse, and not pleasant. Would I stay here again? Heck yeah, if it was a business meeting. If I was choosing the location, maybe, maybe not. Would depend if something that appeared better was available. BTW - I was there during an exceptional heat wave. Nice to find out the pool was closed - no sign, no mention at front desk, nothing at all. Thanks. No idea why it was closed. If it was to upgrade, maybe they should let current guests in on it. Also, what if that was a selling point in my reservation? Any return, rebate, etc.? And Marriott should not be happy with that blue glass monstrosity they erected in JW Marriott. I can't imagine a place more out of character with Indy than that place. Isn't there a city planning board????? How did that place get passed? (you want character? check out Crowne Plaza at Union Station - wow!!). I was not impressed with that blue glass monolith - kept thinking of "2001 - a Space Oddessey". Wanted to grunt like a monkey and go up and touch it. Might be a great hotel, but man......

Reviews.Title: “convenient location for visiting and exploring downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: bikeman_surrey
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay in Indianapolis, then you could do worse than staying ay this hotel. I found it to be a great location - easy walk to downtown, if like me you like to walk around a bit, rather than driving or cabs, then there is plenty to see/do near this hotel. Victory Field (baseball) is right across the street, Circle City Mall and NCAA Hall of Fame are not far and you could even walk to the Lucas Stadium. Indianapolis is a pretty safe city, and I certainly did not feel threatened at all - even late at night. The hotel staff are all very pleasant, especially the valet parking staff & porters - really welcoming and helpful - outstanding!. Beds were comfortable and rooms are fine and well equipped. The only complaint I had was that the swimming pool is currently being refurbished and is out of action. It would have been nice to know this ahead of time because I rose early on my morning, fancied a nice swim and walked down to find swimming pool locked up. No sign or anything to indicate it was out of use. Otherwise, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: aks_va
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference that was held in the hotel, and it was quite nice. Comfy beds, good gym, and quiet. And the room service -- provided by one of the restaurants in the hotel -- was delicious! Indianapolis was rather bleak and cold when I was there, so it helped that this hotel was connected to a mall via walkways. I also saw a really good play one night at the Indiana Repertory Theater, which is located just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right downtown”
Reviews.Author: SteelersGal85
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for any event at the convention center. YOu can get most places downtown without going outside by using the skywalk. The hotel is clean and the staff was friendly. Within walking distance of any type of restaurant or entertainment downtown. Will definitely stay here again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “spacious new marriott downtown”
Reviews.Author: JFerguson
Reviews.Content: This is a great Marriott hotel in the center of downtown. Newer than many other Marriott hotels, the lobby, conference rooms, and common areas are spacious and elevators fast (plus, there are enough to accommodate crowds). The rooms and bathrooms are also spacious and comfortable. Unfortunately, no free wi-fi, but other amenities available as expected. Great space for large meetings and conferences.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous service and experience”
Reviews.Author: advisor59
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived at the door to when we left, we had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I stayed there about 4 or 5 years ago and recall how pleasant the stay was which is why we chose it this time. I think they have just gotten better! The rooms were lovely, large bathrooms (with 4 women that is imperative), the service fantastic (my mom the news hound was greeted with not 1 but 2 complimentary newspapers on Sunday am) and we had a delicious brunch. Sorry it was such a short visit but we'll be back for sure! Thanks Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for a business hotel in Indy. You won't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBriggs
Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights at a conference. Overall, it was a very nice, convenient, but overall somewhat unremarkable experience. Your basic solid business hotel. Check-in was a bit slow, but once you got through the line the front desk staff was excellent. The food throughout the conference was solid, they made a very successful effort to manage the queues at the buffet lines ('over here, shorter line..., etc.). Wireless was a bit sketchy (may have improved since then), and you'd find huddle of folks in different seemingly random nooks and crannies of the hotel where there were pockets of wifi connectivity. Location is great, right in downtown, a few blocks from steakhouses and the Nordstrom's. Overall, if you are doing business in Indy, this is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonNoah
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, great location, very clean, this hotel is actually closer to the mall and bars and places to eat than the JW Marriott. I would rather stay here and spend less than you would at the other Marriott. Think twice before drinking in the Champs bar located on the first floor...my wife and I and a friend drank for about an hour....our bill was over $70 and none of us had more than 2 drinks apiece. Go down the street to the Ram or somewhere before drinking here. Hotel is awsome....Champs is overpriced and overrated. Also, do not park at the hotel ($33 for 1 night). Park in the parking garages around town ($22 for 24 hours).

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous50226
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a gymnastics meet at the Indiana Convention Center. The room was very clean and comfortable. Although the hotel was full for the weekend, we had great service during check-in and checkout. I asked to checkout an hour late and was quickly told by the staff that it would not be a problem. Ate at Champions in the hotel for dinner and found the food to be quite good for a hotel restaurant. Had breakfast at the Circle City Bar and Grille and the buffet was very nice. My only small complaint was that it was a little noisy at times...The walls seemed a little thin. But after 11PM I didn't hear much else. My family slept well and we would definitely stay here again! I recommend self parking...we found a garage right across the street that was attached by walkway that was $10 a day. Saved quite a bit of money that way and if you don't mind handling your own bags, it keeps you out of the hustle and bustle around the front of the hotel during check-in and checkout. The enclosed walkway to the convention center was an added plus. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Snob at the desk.”
Reviews.Author: Fitzit
Reviews.Content: There was a snob at the desk. I ignored her and checked in. I came back after the shift change and got everything I wanted or needed in 3 questions and 3 answers. Even when snowed in you can get around. The hotel connects to the convention center and several other hotels connect to it too. from there you can connect to malls, theaters and other attractions without ever going out in the snow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: jdshaw971
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Downtown Indy. The locations perfect and the walkways allow you to get nearly anywhere downtown without going outside. We found the staff to be friendly. They switched our room to a city view without a problem. Only complaint is the hotel bar closed at 12:05am on NYE. My wife and I had just returned from the ISO concert and wanted to get a glass of wine, but couldn't because they had just closed the bar. Valet is overpriced, so just self park your car. Overall... Nice stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, yet pricey”
Reviews.Author: grandpaT44881
Reviews.Content: we very much enjoyed our stay downtown. loved the building. the kids loved the pool. everything was great but I do feel it is a little pricey, but this is a "full service" marriott and you do get what you pay for. also, being a rewards member defiantly helps and do recomend that... will visit agian in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chicago-60653
Reviews.Content: We planned a last-minute weekend get-away to Indianapolis . Thus, we were expecting a nice & pleasant visit. We received a great rate (50% off list price) from Priceline, but I must say we were still disappointed in this hotel. I travel almost every week for work and have stayed at many Marriott properties. This stay was my worst this year. Let me start with the parking rates. $32 for valet parking in Indianapolis is a rip off. As an alternative we found free parking on the street (which is available during the weekends). Then my next issue was with the check-in staff. The person at the front desk was not the most friendliest. I was expecting some details about the hotel or some information about parking, restaurants, etc . Unfortunately, he never provided any. Thus, I had to pull information from him. The room was just average. There was nothing special about the room size or décor. The bathroom was just ok too. The fitness center was a joke. It has a several treadmills, but as far as weights/equipment it is lacking for a hotel this size. Also, the pool was the smallest I have seen in a hotel with this many rooms. This hotel is rated 3 ½ stars. At the most I would rate this hotel a 3 star. Overall this hotel is below average to average. I would never stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURIOUS!”
Reviews.Author: tkmrazek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so gorgeous! They do everything first class. We stayed in December and the hotel was decked out for Christmas and was just outstanding. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location....”
Reviews.Author: hexx17
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and have used name your own price on priceline both times and got on outstanding deal versus the published online prices. Our goal was to get a hotel downtown Indy within walking distance to the restaurants and bars and this one was exactly what we wanted. The rooms are vert comfortable and have everything we needed. There is a fridge in the room but you have to search for it as it's in the dresser. Great view of Lucas Oil stadium as well. We didnt visit and of the bars or restaurants in the hotel either time as we have our favorites downtown we like. The parking and valet is expensive and we just park at the public parking lot across the street although the hotel tries to discourage this as you can save about $20 a night. Taxi service was readily available out in front of the hotel for the times we didnt want to walk. The had a business center that came in helpful as we needed a printout and this was suprisinly free of charge. The pool area was decent with an indoor pool and hot tub. This hotel appears to have alot more to offer to business travelers as well, however for our trip, we didnt need any more than just a comfortable room :)

Reviews.Title: “Too little for Too much!”
Reviews.Author: eveder1
Reviews.Content: I am writing this as a courtesy to others who may be looking for a romantic weekend and don't want to waste time or money. We ordinarily stay at the Omni Sevrin downtown however; due to the Colts game it was booked. We opted to stay at the Marriott. With two small children at home my wife and I seldom get away so this was a special weekend! We booked a "KING" room with the hopes that it would be elegant and set the mood for our night together. When we arrived we were greated by a smug young lady who told us that they gave our room away and put us in a double bed. I asked her if it was the same price and she said it is. I was upset and asked her why they would give our room away. She stated that there is "no guaruntee" of the room you get even by booking online.. Hello!? I asked to speak with the manager. He came out with the same smug atitude and told me the same story. We also had a coupon voucher for the room because of our family being an employee of the comapany. He would not allow us to use it either. I accepted the room because it was a Colts game weekend and everything was booked. He did give us a coupon for breakfast...After I countinued to complain but neither were very apologetic. We went to our room to find out that the Motel 8's rooms are just as nice. I paid $350.00 with tax for a room that looked like the Red Roof Inn PLUS parking! NEVER will be stay again...I will book my room at the OMNI Severin WAY in advance!!! Just FYI...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Terrible Parking rates.”
Reviews.Author: rockfist11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Downtown in Mid September and were very pleased with the hotel. The Lobby is fantastic and the rooms are very comfortable, modern and clean. I agree with a previous review that this Marriott is a step above your normal Marriott chain hotel. From a swift check in to Strawberry and Lemon water in the Lobby the Hotel aspect of the trip could not have been nicer. The metal salt water pool was fantastic as well as the Hot tub. The bathroom while not overly spacious, was a little bigger than normal. We parked at the hotel parking for two nights and it was $56. That is just standard overnight rates. I must say it left a bitter taste in my mouth leaving when otherwise I couldn't have been happier. On a side note make sure to visit the Eagles Nest at the top of the Hyatt. It was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a stay in Downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: vegas005
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with excellent rooms and quick elevators. Hotel has many restaurants and bars but they are grossly overpriced. The good news is you are within walking distance of many fine restaurants, shops and bars. You can even walk 15 minutes to the world famous Slippery Noodle Blues Bar. Parking is 32 dollars a day so watch out for that, but for a downtown hotel close to everything (including the football, baseball and basketball stadiums) this place is a don't miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbeat
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of Marriotts (platinum) but I think this is as good as it gets. I don't know who trained the staff there but I would hire any of them in a NY minute. The front desk was manned by a wonderful young woman (initials I think L. E. W.) who attempted to make my stay award winning by starting the check-in process quick, easy and accommidating. Her attitude set the tone for all the other staff members I came in contact with. This property is ajoining the convention center by a ped-bridge on the second floor and only a short two blocks to where all the best restaurants are located.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjandljtravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the downtown Indianapolis Marriott for one night in mid-July. Traveling just with wife for pleasure. We originally stayed at the Marriott due to its relatively low internet rate and were pleasantly impressed by the hotel. Originally, we were scheduled for two nights but decided at 3 pm the next day to check out - they did not charge extra for the late check-out. The lobby and room were equally nice - very well furnished with nice amenities. I disagree with a previous reviewerer comparing this to a Motel 6 - this Marriott is a very nice, higher-end hotel typical for other full-service Marriott hotels. The valet, bellhop and check-in staff all provided great service and the check-in experience was smooth. Used room service for breakfast - food quality was excellent but a little on the pricey side. Concierge was very helpful and friendly. I agree with a previous reviewer that the pool is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Unresponsive Staff, Uncomfortable bed, Feels like a Motel 6 Highrise.”
Reviews.Author: cxbonne
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worse hotels I have had the misfortune of visiting. The room was not completely cleaned (which usually means things are gonna be bad) when I entered. Bathroom had a horrible smell that lingured in it. When I called the front desk they advised me a house keeper would come and reclean the room. This never happened. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and screaming teenagers in the hallway added to my inability to sleep. When I called the Front Desk no one answered. I tried ten minutes later again no one answered. Frustrated I went to the Front Desk and saw why. There was 50 people in the lobby and 1 staff member behind the desk. None of the Bellman could help me. They advised me to wait. I waited and 20 minutes later I was offered sympathy but nothing else. I had to drive to Wal Mart at midnight to buy a feather bed and fan just to make the bed tolerable and drown out the screaming kids. This hotel is a joke. Smells bad, oblivious and uncaring staff and not housekeeping as promised. Parking is overpriced also. Indianapolis isn't San Francisco but at almost 30 bucks for a weekend night parking?! Do your homework if you wanna stay here or probably better stay somewhere else! Also nothing against Motel 6 they offer a resonable priced service. If I had payed 50 bucks to stay here I would have been more understanding.

Reviews.Title: “It was basic USA hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mitsarspb
Reviews.Content: The location is nice. It was close up to shopping mall and American football stadium. It was just 5 or 10 minutes walk. Unfortunately there was no good restaurant, but only some junk food with good Guinness. The swimming pool was very small not like I expected from Marriot. But it has very big area for workshops and conferences. And the gala hole is also very nice. It was also helpful that they have post service and receptionist was very helpful go get tickets on nascar racing. Last issue is that you got free Internat only on lobby!

Reviews.Title: “great location but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Coachbill
Reviews.Content: Here for a convention. Nice hotel with a great location w/in walking distance to everything downtown (don't skip the Wild Beaver). Great location for a convention w/alot of meeting space. Parking is expensive. Green line to the airport stops right in front of Champions ($7 to airport vs $35 cab fare). Busy/fun scene in lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: HoosierHyphenate
Reviews.Content: After the wedding my wife and I stayed here. The staff at the desk that night, were extremely kind and helpful. We were checked in very quickly and on our way. All was appreciated. The Starbucks and breakfast buffet were both pluses for the next day. I've stayed here before and still have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place, OK location”
Reviews.Author: cincifoodie
Reviews.Content: Room was clean. Service was OK. They have a Starbucks in the lobby which is always a plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere USA - not luxury for Marriott”
Reviews.Author: callia02
Reviews.Content: Below average hotel for Marriott, but above avg for Indy. I was surprised to see that this hotel which set me back $200 a night was so incredibly average. It could have been a Best Western with adjourning rooms and noise. A nice perk was the flatscreen television, but there were no art hangings or decorative appointments. Service seemed to lack training. Cups were out for water and televisions at restaurant bar were static (during March Madness). Lobby lacked elegance or intimacy and I would suggest staying at the 14 West Boutique hotel if you have an event at the Convention Center. 14 West has incredible gourmet meals as well and is worth the trip. If you are looking for a chain and do not want to stay in a train (Crown Plaza), pick the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, good accommodations”
Reviews.Author: WorkTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful, and very eager to help / meet your requests. The lobby is impressive, and you really feel taken care of. The bathrooms are very large, which is nice. The fitness center was one of the larger that I've seen, with plenty of machines and weights. The only drawbacks are small ones : * beds seemed less than I am used to with Marriotts. * Toilets are hard to flush and operate like a crush ship - very loud and forceful * Thermostat does not allow for 'on' feature, meaning no white noise * Parking is quite expensive and hard to maneuver But all in all, the pros definitely outweigh the bad, and I would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great, parking (self) was a bit...”
Reviews.Author: Trendymommy
Reviews.Content: Staff was great, parking (self) was a bit tight especillay if u have a bigger car. Rooms were fair. On the smaller side compared to other marriotts. Our room had a stuufy smell, not so fresh.. Beds were not so heavenly but not terrible .. Not really what we were used to with other matriotts. Request an end room . The hallways were really noisy and your neighbors are easily heard.. Diont know if this is the best indianapolis has to offer. We will be wiiling to explore other hotels before returning.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome local, comfortable beds, spacious, clean, wondeful service.”
Reviews.Author: MaqueChoux
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on locale since we were going to fly in and avoid a car rental. It was across the street from the Fieldhouse and everything was completely accessible to us. Whatever was a bit of a walk we got through by taking Indy's then free buses. The service was wonderful, the bed was extremely comfortable, and we were in a very spacious suite. I loved my stay here and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Travels-with-Billy
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because of its location to the Convention Center and Lucas Oil Stadium. The hotel is connected tot he Convention Center via a single 2nd floor cross walk. We loved this location and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Indy”
Reviews.Author: kw2405
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is quickly becoming my favorite hotel in Indy. The Good: Rooms are spacious. Bathrooms are huge. Room service is quick and reasonably priced for a downtown hotel. The staff is friendly and eager to assist. They happily allow you to bring drinks from the restaurant up to your room. The Bad: As far as Colts games in the winter are concerned, this hotel is less convenient than the Omni or Crown Plaza. However, the service you receive makes up for the extra couple of blocks you walk.

Reviews.Title: “Never Better”
Reviews.Author: DestinedDiva
Reviews.Content: My significant other took me to Indianapolis to see my favorite team, the Colts play the Broncos. From the time we stepped into the Marriott until the time we left, the service was superb. I have stayed at other Marriotts in other states, but this one is the best. The staff was very friendly and attentive and stopped at nothing to accomodate us. That goes from the Valet staff, the Front Desk staff, the Bell Hop staff, the Concierge, Room Service Staff, to Housekeeping. The room was clean, with fresh & crisp white linens. The bed is the most important to me when choosing my hotel, but this bed was as comfortable as mine at home. When I come back to Indy, this will definitely be my hotel of choice. It was like a home away from home! Thanks Marriott-Downtown Indy Staff for making our stay a most pleasant one!

Reviews.Title: “Well-Maintained Property”
Reviews.Author: GottaRun
Reviews.Content: Two years ago when we attended the Bands of America competition we stayed at the Indy Downtown Marriott and I admired the staff’s professionalism, courtesy and the hotel’s amenities. Ditto this return trip. It’s nice to see this property is well-maintained. The hotel is perfect for large groups, conventions or just for folks spending a weekend to enjoy a Colt’s game or a girl’s weekend out. It was easy for us to walk everywhere: the mall, Lucas Oil Stadium, museums. I especially enjoyed the Canal Walk and White River State Park. The hotel is only two blocks away from these wonderful trails for running.

Reviews.Title: “Willing to go the extra mile!”
Reviews.Author: FLHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had an earlier issue regarding leaving possesions behind in a room. The items were never recovered but manager, S Blalock rectified the situation in a fair and equitable way and I am now a very happy and loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: rogerwessel
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible, clean, friendly staff, nice room, great location. Really like it -nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: NewlywedTravellers
Reviews.Content: We visit Indianapolis frequently, and at least twice a year, we stay there for a few nights to enjoy area attractions. Our favorite hotel, hands down is the Mariott. It is perfectly located in the middle of everything. Customer service is great. Beds comfortable. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location to downtown”
Reviews.Author: SherryHa
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable. I did have troubles connecting to the internet, it costs $12.95 per day. I am a Marriott Rewards member and was given a key to the concierge floor -- free breakfasts and snacks and desserts and drinks -- they have a schedule however - so check it if you're going to use it. It is a nice perk. I was at this hotel for a convention. The convention services were excellent, so was all the hotel staff. The hotel is located next to the Westin, and closeby, a few blocks, to lots of activities - walking distance to a shopping mall, and lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Gonna get every penny.”
Reviews.Author: Biscuits1014
Reviews.Content: We decided to make a weekend trip for my birthday to Indianapolis and of course we wanted to stay downtown in the heart of all the action. Firstly you have to pay almost $30 a night for parking or you have to park a block away on the street for free. Ok we decided to find some things to do but wait we have to pay $13 to connect to the internet which you have to use a phone cord or use their computer at $.80 a minute. We wanted to stay in and order room service for breakfast, but the prices are astronomical. I am not kidding $12 for fruit and yogurt? I knew it would be expensive but even that seems to much. The hotel is nice but my goodness in this day and age no free wifi and parking. I live near Chicago and they don't make you do that, and this is Indianapolis. Liked the city, but we will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: DougOzo
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to tell you how good the service was at this hotel. I travel for business on a regular basis. I am accustomed to staying at full service hotels. I have only had better service at the Hilton Resort in Cabo San Lucas. I was with a group of 20 people visiting Indy to plan a convention. From the moment I got out of my car at the valet, I was bombarded with greetings. Every door was opened for me. Every employee of the hotel, down to the maintenance people greeted you. Every person that was with me made the exact same comment. The location is perfect for conventions. The decor is very nice and updated. The facility was spotless. The food they served us at every turn was above grade for hotel banquet service. Location to restaurants is perfect. The majority of downtown restaurants are within 3 blocks of the hotel. Only complaint would be that the walls in the rooms are very thin. I would highly recommend this property

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service - a delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: lindaannie
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, what makes it exceptional is the service. A perfect example: i was struggling down the hall to my room with several packages and a suitcase. A housekeeper saw me, came over and insisted on helping me to my room, even opening the door for me. I gave the room a 4 out of 5 because the air conditioner did not adequately cool the room and no in-room moives.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the beautiful Indy Marriot...”
Reviews.Author: jdiddy430
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the downtown Marriot in Indianapolis for a wedding in July of 2009. The first impression when you walk in is that this is a beautiful, modern, updated hotel. The lobby is comfortable and beautiful, with fruit flavored water for you to enjoy when you come in from that Indiana humidity! The staff was very friendly, and when we checked in we were the V.I.P. of the day, which entitled us to free appetizers at the in-hotel restaurant, Champions. The rooms were clean, updated and comfortable. There was a flat-screen HDTV (with only a couple HD channels), down pillows and comfortable beds. The bathroom was very roomy and featured Bath & Body Works toiletries, which was awesome. Usually you get some grandma-smelling lotions made in God knows where. The fitness room and the pool were top-notch. The fitness room was high quality, and you can actually get a good workout done there. The pool was an infinity pool, with a metal bottom, which has an interesting feel on your toes. The hot tub is also very nice and hot. There is also a guest laundry that we were able to use to get all of our clothes clean for like $6, a fraction of the cost it would cost to send them out. The restaurant, Champions, is a sports bar, with good beer and good bar food to eat. The atmosphere is nice in there and the staff is very friendly. We attended a wedding for my cousin there, and the banquet facilities were very nice, the food was great and the service was friendly and great. There is an urban mall that is essentially across the street, with all of your standard mall retailers, great dining and a food court. Nice place to get out of the heat. Basically, this Marriott, like most Marriotts I have stayed at, was a slam dunk. Outstanding stay, great food and amenities, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Indy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was a nice hotel. Being Marriott Rewards Gold, we received access to the lounge, which served a nice breakfast. It also served snacks in the evening, but I never made it to the lounge in the evening. The rooms were very nice and comfortable, and nicely decorated. Internet access was for a fee in the room, but was free in the lobby and in the lounge. The location was very convenient to downtown attractions, and hotel was connected to the convention center by a skybridge. You can actually get to the Circle Centre Mall without stepping foot outside, though it's a bit of a roundabout way. I did not have a vehicle during this trip, so I can't comment on how much parking was, but I did see that they offer valet. Based on this stay, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Downtown Location, Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: athenian01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January for a leisure weekend getaway. It exceded our expectations. Excellent service, location was top notch, lots of little extras that people appreciate like the spring water in the lobby flavored with fresh strawberries and lemons. Just a nice extra touch. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated. We booked the hotel through a discount website for $49 so it was an incredible deal. I would deffinetly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel Staff in Downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: swilfong
Reviews.Content: I stay in Indianapolis quite often and I have stayed in just about every hotel downtown. My favorite by far is the Marriott. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are great. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “OK, some service issues”
Reviews.Author: BSB21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April and am a Marriott Gold Elite member. As other have mentioned, parking is priced at $30 per night (Ok for Chicago, but not for Indianapolis). The public areas are in great condition. I wish that they had spent as much money in renovating the rooms. Here is where my gripe is: 1) When we arrived, we were given keys with access to the Concierge Lounge, yet no one told us that it was closed during the day. It is only open for breakfast and evening snacks. So, they lock the lounge during the day and one can not even get a bottle of water. As we did not know about this policy, we went down to the front desk and asked that our keys be reprogrammed for access to the lounge. Once again, no one told us that the Lounge is closed. It took several minutes of sticking our key in the door and call to the Front Office Supervisor, to inform us of this. 2) Prior to arrival, we had asked for a room with extra towels and a hotel employee confirmed this request via email. To our surprise, our room did not have a single bath towel. It took two calls and a little over two hours to get some towels. Overall, this is a solid 3-star hotel. It takes more than a pretty lobby to be a 4-star hotel. I am thinking that we might try the Conrad, on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Updated, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: zipandlucy
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The rooms were very clean and updated, with plenty of room for myself, my husband, and 3 young children.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Normally we aren't huge fans of Marriott branded properties but this one was nice! The room was clean. Bathroom was nice, and spacious. Beds were really comfortable. The paintings that were behind the beds in place of headboards were a bit "loud" but that's okay. My only gripe was that we paid $56 via Priceline for the hotel, but had to pay $28 to valet the car (plus tip). The valets were great, one even walked my husband to the car when he forgot his cellphone charger in it. But yeah, $28?! Self-parking was full due to an event downtown at one of the stadiums. Every other garage in the area was full too due to the event (not sure what it was). It just kind of irritated me that the hotel wasn't full, but the parking garage was because non-guests can park in it and fill it up. Not cool. Essentially the only way out of the valet parking was to leave downtown for dinner and come back later after the event goers had left downtown. Didn't want to bother. There were quite a few people milling around the lobby the whole time. But I've noticed this quite often in downtown Indy. This hotel was a bit further out than some other locations we've stayed downtown. In the super cold January temps the walk toward Circle Center and restaurants just beyond there wasn't the greatest. I'd stay again though!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overall a hairried experience, I won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: Windsor999
Reviews.Content: It's not often that I am really dis-satisfied with a hotel, and part of that is I travel a lot and I understand when things get a little far out or perhaps the hotel is understaffed. However, after 3 stays at this property, I feel that it is really not well run and I doubt I will be back here under any circumstance. The property itself is beautiful, a grand lobby, great looking decor, a pretty restaurant -starbucks booth in the lobby, comfy beds and linens -what's not to like right? ---Well I'll tell ya. I stayed at this property for a week in June 2008 -taking a class that was south of the hotel. EVERY night that I came back to the hotel there were tons of people in the lobby waiting to check in, or ???. It was hard to get to the elevators. Once upstairs the halls were often full of people and then the room internet didn't work. I called repeadidly to have it fixed -to no avail. The halls remained loud (as they had been on my previous 2 visits) well into the night. So not a restful nights sleep. My room key wouldn't open my room door twice which meant I had to go and wait downstairs with all the others waiting for ?? The gym had broken equipment -which I was told would be fixed -on my first visit in May, in June it was still broken. After a while -everything about this hotel became annoying, waiting for the elevators, not being able to work out on site, dealing with the numb staff, having to use the internet in the lobby -because at the time the lounge didn't have wireless working either, being woken up at night by doors slamming or people laughing/screaming. --Bear in mind I spend more than a third of the year on the road. This hotel really pushed my patience. In the end I checked out of this Hotel a day early and moved down the block to the Conrad. Although the Conrad didn't meet my per diem rate it was well worth the extra $95 to have some peace and to finally sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: gobelins
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at how remarkably good this hotel was. We thought it was a terrific value for the weekend rate of $99/night. While the set-up is fairly standard for city high rise hotels of this type, the little things such as front desk, bar and restaurant service, bed comfort, decor, etc. made for an exceptionally pleasant stay. We found each and every employee we met to be friendly and helpful. Oh, ok, there was one guy who obviously hadn't had enough sleep the night before, but everyone else was fabulous. We hadn't been to Indianapolis for years and were expecting a dreary experience downtown in mid winter. It was anything but dreary and we recommend it without any caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: colts_fans_08
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited Indianapolis for the Colts / Titans game the weekend of 12/27. We arrived late, after midnight. Check-in was fast and efficient. we needed to run a quick errand and our vehicle was brought around in just a few minutes. Room service was great. Most times it takes forever to have something delivered to your room. Late night snacks and breakfast were both delivered in in minutes . Breakfast was early. . We could not have asked for a better stay.The staff was friendly & helpful. Valet parking and Bellman were super. The in hotel Starbucks offered the best service we ever had. The walk to the stadium is about 5 minutes. Great restaurant on site and more close by. We will definelty stay here on our next trip (which will include a couple of days for sightseeing).

Reviews.Title: “This is how your run a hotel”
Reviews.Author: GJCAMA
Reviews.Content: Credit should be given where credit is due. Staff: The staff at this location could not have done anything better. They were attentive; respectful and on point. The staff members demonstrated team work; and although it was a bit hectic this week, the staff demonstrated or at least it seemed that they loved their job. Location: Convenient, Convenient, Convenient! Close to restaurants, museum/exhibits while connected to sky walks, it made a safe and comfortable environment to be in, even after a few drinks. Restaurants On site: A bit over priced, but not something to really be annoyed with. If you want the convenience, I guess you have to pay. The restaurant staff was limited, which made the dining experience much longer than expected. I was shocked at the limitation of staff, at first, but it was explained to me later that (2) employees decided to not come to work. The Starbucks right on site was a treat. Very smart move! Rooms: The room was clean, and kept up - no complaints in this department. Concierge Service: AMAZING! Great recommendations to restaurants and local clubs and/or bars. Very honest, when it came to recommending places. Just tell them what you want and what you like, and they will pair you up with the right place. Valet: For an additional 3 bucks, just let them do it! Parking your self 25 dollars, Valet 28 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: greenmonstah
Reviews.Content: We just had the pleasure of spending the weekend at this property and it is a contender for best hotel experience ever. Excellent professional service and attention from arrival to departure. We were even staying there for 2 nights free using reward points, but we were treated as if we had payed top dollar. The hotel is 8 miles and a quick taxi ride from the airport. If you are in town for a sporting event or on business, you will not need to rent a car because everything is within easy walking distance from the downtown area, and for areas further out there are plenty of taxis. There are several staff members at the entrance to open or close doors, assist with luggage, hail a taxi or provide directions. Once inside, we were greeted by a member of staff who welcomed us to the Marriott. There is always a person in the lobby to greet and assist guests, which we found very helpful. Upon check in we were upgraded to a hospitality suite, which consisted large room with separate kitchen, a large bathroom, a king sized murphy bed and large living and dining area with sofa and easy chair. It was actually the size of two rooms and we enjoyed the space to spread out and relax after out flight. The room was spotless. On our second night there we returned to find complimentary turn down service had been provided. Upon checkout, we asked about having our luggage held while we explored the city until our flight in the evening and they were more than happy to accomodate. There is a computer at the concierge desk where we were able to print out our boarding passes. Upon our return, they hailed us a taxi and we were on our way to the airport in moments. The Hotel itself is centrally located and a safe and easy walk to Lucas Oil Stadium, Conseco Fieldhouse, The Indiana State Museum and many historical monuments. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, but we instead took the advice from the tripadvisor forums and had breakfast twice at Patachou, which is on the street that runs behind the hotel. We stopped in at Champions on the ground floor for late night drinks and apps and found it to be a comfy place to unwind after attending the football and basketball games. Every person we encountered made us feel welcome. I highly recommend this hotel if you are headed to Indy for business or pleasure. They really know how to make their guests feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Conference City”
Reviews.Author: Lawrenson
Reviews.Content: We booked this as we were at a Convention, and it is attached to the Indianapolis Convention Centre. Hotel is large and smart, with large airy rooms. It seemed to lack a certain something though – it seemed rather “characterless”. The staff were largely helpful and polite, although it is hard to believe they do not have a set of scales for weighing a guests luggage prior to flying (as the concierge informed us). Would probably try elsewhere when we are in the area again – hotel is fine, but not exceptional enough for a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: SUgirl
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay in downtown Indianapolis this hotel was in a great location. Very close proximity to Rt 65. Great view from our King room on the 10th floor. We overlooked Maryland St and the Lucas stadium and a baseball field. Walking distance to Circle center mall and restaurants. The hotel lobby was clean and the valet (although expensive at $28/night) was prompt and courteous. The valet staff went out of their way to get us some bottles of water for our long drive home. The room was clean and the bathroom was larger than I expected. There was a very convenient Starbucks in the lobby. Be careful to avoid game times as traffic could get congested.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious Gem”
Reviews.Author: ainwa
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, with a very friendly staff. I booked last minute on priceline and got a very good price ($50). I'm afraid that next time I go to Indianapolis I will be afraid to use Priceline in case another hotel takes my bid -- I want to stay at the Downtown Marriott! The bedding in this hotel is the nicest I have ever seen. They have the cotton duvet covers so you know they can be washed easily. Very fluffy and luxurious, with lots of pillows. The bathroom was unusually large with lots of nice appointments. We had a great view of the state capitol building from our room. On site parking is expensive, but street parking is safe. We were there on a Sunday, so parking was free. The hotel staff suggested this as an option. The lobby is beautiful and well appointed. A fresh server of lemon water stands in case you are in need of a beverage. They have a computer to print out your boarding pass and provide assistance to get it done. The night clerk was so friendly and made us feel very welcome. He mentioned that we had booked through priceline and did not make us feel like pariahs for doing so. I had never been to Indianapolis before, and had no idea it was such a beautiful and welcoming city. I hope to have a chance to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: ComputerMaverick
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location that is very convenient for convention center. The hotel has a covered walkway to the convention center. The hotel has just completed a major renovation in the past year. The lobby is fine and the meeting rooms are very nice. Our room was on the 8th floor and had a decent downtown view and a great view of the capitol. The room was decent in size and decor was very good. I was surprised that the renovation did not include upgrading the TVs to HD Widescreens. The room had a refrig and safe. The safe was good size and could allow laptop computer. Bathroom was good size and plenty of counter space. The bed was comfortable, but was not the best for restful sleep with the combination of the quality of pillows. All of the linens, etc. were great. Wireless connectivity was not available and Internet connection was $9.95 a night. I had breakfast buffet in the City Grille rest and was excellent... I recommend a stay at the Marriott for convention visits. Valet parking $28 per day and self park $25. St. Elmo's was very good rest, but the best steak and meal was at Shulas! Outstanding...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service & Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Janice1978
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience I've had in years and we are frequent travelers. All the staff went out of their way to make sure I had a pleasant stay and all my needs were met. Each request I had was met with a smile and the Hoosier Hospitality was evident everywhere.
