There was never a line at the front desk; valet parkers were prompt and helpful; meals were served quickly and were very good--in fact the chef even came out to speak to our table at one of the banquets. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. Yes, it's pricey but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Joscat
Reviews.Content: This hotel far surpassed my expectations. The staff is absolutely wonderful, the food was excellent and the rooms were spacious and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great except ...”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: ...the valet parking While traveling home from the west coast, I arrived to find myself in the middle of a (relatively minor) winter storm in Indianapolis. It was nearly 2AM and I had been up for nearly 18 hours. Snow + fatigue = a recipe for disaster. I made a last-minute reservation at the downtown Indianapolis Marriott. As I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by the valet and asked him to park my car while I checked in. I was just too tired to deal with it and decided the while the $28 fee was outrageous, I might as well pay it vice trying to find a place to park myself. I'm not quite sure what the problem was, but the valet was breathing as if he had just run a marathon. He wrote out the claim check and then shuffled off to parts unknown. When I finished checking in, I noticed that my car was still sitting where I had left it and was still running. When I checked out in the morning, I climbed in to find that my seat had been pushed back as far as it could go and reclined halfway down. A minor inconvenience, to say the least, but irritating nonetheless. Beyond that, my stay was great. The room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. I had a nice view of the nearby RCA dome, the new stadium and the convention center. The location of this hotel is great for just about everything downtown. The breakfast buffet was great - especially given that the night desk clerk comped it for me. I would definitely stay here again. Hopefully next time I'll have a little more time and arrive at a more reasonable hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: lvetravelin
Reviews.Content: This was such a great hotel. The only thing bad I could say is the size of the rooms, but absolutely everything else (including the staff) was wonderful. We only stayed a night, but I was sorry to have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights as part of a convention. Each time I entered the hotel I was greated with a "hello" and when I checked in there were plenty of staff to assist and direct. The room was very clean and quiet. While I was charged $9.95 for interent service (I hate this), most of the other downtown hotels did the same. The room service breakfast ordered the night before was right on time and hot. There was plenty of food and it enabled me to keep working. Well worth the $18 with tip and service charge. I was given a late check out, had no problem checking in for my flight and printing my boarding pass, and stored my luggage while I attended the convention. This hotel did everything right and is what I expect when I travel. If only every hotel could treat their guests like this property. This place has got it right!!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyryE
Reviews.Content: I recently had a two-night stay at the Marriott in Downtown Indianapolis, and I was very pleased with the quality of the hotel and its service. The front desk was very friendly and efficient. Every question I had for them was answered, and I never felt like I was bothering them. The room was a nice size, and there was plenty of storage space. Also, the bathroom was very big with plenty of counter space. I ate twice in Champions, the bar/restaurant off the lobby that had good food and quick service. Also, there were always employees floating around the lobby. They were not overbearing, but they always asked if they could help with anything, or just how your day was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Downtown Marriott”
Reviews.Author: SopranosFan
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Downtown is a nice place to stay. The first thing I look for is cleanliness and I would rate their hotel as above average in this category. The room was comfortable, I didn't have any complaints with the beds. I thought the room was a bit small, but not too bad. The bathroom was nice sized. If I had any complaints about the rooms, they would be there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom to take out the steam from showering, the shower head was not the best, and the walls are terribly thin. You can hear the noise from the other rooms and hallways all too well. If you are bothered by noise and a light sleeper, bring ear plugs. Hotel was convenient to the convention center and RCA dome - linked by sky bridge. There are many restaurants in the area and a shopping mall not too far, all withing walking distance. I would invite you to explore. Downtown Indy is nice and has a safe feel. One recommendation I can make for dinner is the Weber Grill restaurant that just opened (July, 2007). The food there is EXCELLENT. Yes, it is a restaurant that is owned by the company that makes Weber Grills and you will see the grills displayed throughout the restaurant, but the food there is extremely good. The Key Lime Cheesecake is the best I've ever had. Get there early to avoid lines. One of the best things about this hotel is their level of service. I no more than ask for something and it seems like it was delivered immediately. I had a problem with my Internet connection, it turns out it was a firewall problem on MY end, not theirs but they had a qualified person up right away to look at it. I needed pillows late at night for my back problem and sleep apnea - a lot of them and it was no problem. The pillows were delivered right away. Everyone at the hotel was professional and quick to deliver your requests. The food was good, we at the the Champions restaurant...typical hotel restaurant flair, moderately priced but good food and service. On site Starbucks was handy in the morning for coffee! I would most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “typical business hotel - nothing great”
Reviews.Author: drcrab
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel because the original hotel attached to the conference was booked out. This was the spillover hotel (since the conference was held at the Westin, which is next door). We'd stayed in the Marriott before (Sydney and other places) and we were confident of the sort of stay we'd be in for. And we were not disappointed. We had the typical business hotel feel (nice hotel overall, overpriced restaurant, busy busy = noisy)... but what made it not so nice was that it was overfull with conferences and delegates (I'm not sure how many conferences/meetings they had per day!). The bell boys were nice and polite and generally the front of house was friendly too. We'd just found out that we were pregnant and they remembered, which was nice. However, what annoyed us was one particular concierge man who was condescending and patronising. We wanted to book the limo service from the hotel to the airport (costs 12 USD per person, which would have made it 24 USD for two of us; a taxi would cost between 23-27!). He spent about 5 minutes trying to dissuade us from asking him to book it (it's easier to get it from the front; it's faster to get to the airport). We explained to thim that our trip from airport to the hotel was diabolical (taxi seats felt like the springs had sprung for good, wipers were not working, air con not working, windows were down so got wet from rain!) and he asked where we were from and whether we had taxis where we lived?!! (what's that got to do with anything?!!). Another time, we wanted to rent a car and previously asked one of the concierges whether we had to pay to park in the hotel carpark. There were 3 of us together when we asked and the woman had said that it was free for hotel guests. We were real happy so on the day we rented the car, we approached this same condescending person and asked him for the pass to the car park and he said that we had to pay 21USD for the day. It wasn't the fact that we had to pay that got us, it was what he said when we told him that we had been misinformed. He said "oh, maybe you asked whether you could park at the marriott courtyard? Maybe you misunderstood" (the courtyard is just 2 blocks away and anyway, it's not free there - you need to pay 10USD). Instead of apologising and saying that we had somehow been misinformed, he implied that the 3 of us had misunderstood his colleague. How rude. Customer service - I think not. Not impressed with this person AT ALL. Am very tempted to write a complaint letter when I can be bothered. Apart from him and the very noisy corridors (even though we were located at the end of one), it's an average hotel. Because we paid 145USD/night without breakfast (which costs 13.50 +++), it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: ckdjr60301
Reviews.Content: I was able to get the room for 4 nights for $55 a night through Priceline (bidding). I was hoping to get the Hyatt Regency but it was closed for remodeling. The hotel is ok. It wasn't great but it wasn't bad, either. I had a room on the top floor, a concierge floor. The view from my room of the Indianapolis skyline was breathtaking. The people working at the hotel did everything to make my stay great. They were all so friendly and professional. The hotel was FULL of families and children. This is definitely NOT a place to go if you want rest. The walls were paper thin and I was awaken every morning by children running and screaming down the hallways. Though the hotel wasn't old, the room was dated, no, it was ugly. The decor of the room looked like something from a roadside Holiday Inn in Texarkana. The absolute worst thing about this hotel was the parking. $25.00 a day to valet. This is insane. Though I was able to get a decent price on the room, I felt like the nickel and dimed me to death. I will definitely bid again on Priceline, but will hope to get the Hyatt (when they reopen) or the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but good”
Reviews.Author: Toad-and-Fern
Reviews.Content: Overall a 3+ rating I stay at this hotel several times a year. If you are a light sleeper either bring ear plugs or don’t stay here. If you are not a light sleeper then this is a very good hotel with very good service. There are a lot of meeting rooms in the hotel and the hotel is directly adjacent to the convention center so one day you may have the hotel to yourself, the next day there are a thousand teenagers (literally) clogging up access to the elevators. The hotel is the farthest from the mall of the main hotels (Hyatt, Hilton, Conrad, Westin) but it is only two short blocks away and it is connected to an inside walkway that takes you to the mall – be careful though, part of the walkway to the Marriott goes through the convention center and they block this off (with big metal gates) sometime very early in the evening. It is not bad to walk the half block outside when this happens except when it is raining or very cold. The lobby is nice, marble tile with a nice design. It lacks a little in sitting areas but what they do have is aesthetic and adequate except when they are crowded. There are two restaurants. One is a sports bar with typical sports bar food. The tilapia was surprisingly spicy and good. Champions has a bad pool table, a dart board, and TVs everywhere. The staff is great at trying to find the game you want to watch on satellite. The blackened chicken ceaser salad was also good. The other restaurant (Circle City) looks and tastes like every hotel restaurant you have every eaten at – good not great, and a little overpriced, but again, it is what you would expect. There is a Starbucks in the lobby with cute Starbucks girls with nice smiles and quick service. The bar at Circle City has better drinks and better service unless they are really crowded – management does not seem to understand that more people means they need more servers, but the ones there work really hard to keep up. When it is not crowded the service at this bar is quick and friendly, especially Jen and Tyra. The rooms are standard for a nice hotel and are normally very clean. The bathrooms are small but nice with marble tops. There is adequate closet space. The beds are comfortable, but as of this writing only one floor has gone to the Marriott Beds. There is a TV inside an armoire (like most hotels) with an adequate number of channels – warning when you turn on the TV it comes on SO LOUD that you could hear the TV in the next room. And that leads to the real problem with this hotel – it is very noisy. You can hear outside noise, you can hear other guest open the doors, you can hear the elevators (main elevators clank, and the service elevators whir loudly), and you can even hear the sound of, well, urination from the next room (as well as people talking in a normal voice). Turn on your TV and bring ear plugs and you will be fine though. I have found the service to be mostly great. The are a lot of younger people working here, so you will find an isolated incident where the response is not appropriate, but overall they bend over backwards to make you happy. Matt, one of the managers is almost annoying in wanting to make sure you are satisfied. Ask and you will receive it if your request is at all reasonable. Pros: -Adjacent to the convention center -Walkway to the mall -Nice lobby -Good Service -Decent restaurants and bars -Clean rooms Cons: -Noisy -Sometimes overly crowded -Noisy -Did I mention it was noisy?

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good...”
Reviews.Author: sletohdarnoc7355
Reviews.Content: I stayed between Feb. 25-27 and did not have a good stay. First, when we tried to check in at 4 (check in time), they said they ran out of room keys. So then we waited for 2 and a half hours for our rooms. The rooms are starting to show their wear and tear and could use a renovation. One day, I brought leftovers from another restaurant and needed a plastic fork. They told me I needed to buy food from room service if I wanted one. That is ridiculous. They are only "At My Service" if I pay for it; even though I paid $180-night in a standard room. I recommend upgrading to the concierege lounge-- it's a great value. However, don't stay here... go to Hilton, Conrad, Hyatt, or Embassy Suites. It's better there.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Nice”
Reviews.Author: azurdee
Reviews.Content: We were in town for just one night, but this hotel should be rated higher than cat. 4. The lobby is plush with marble floors and huge ceilings. The service was excellent, everyone was there to greet you and help you out any way they could, grabbing the doors as you entered the lobby and made sure every question was answered. The lobby offers wonderful strawberry water, lemon/lime water, shoe shine, great restaurant, sports bar, and many other nice things. Both my husband and I have stayed in hundreds of Marriotts all over the world and we would consider this to be almost a JW. We were on the 15th floor with a great view of the capitol and downtown. The rooms are average size and the bathroom is larger than most Marriotts. The only difference we saw in the room compared to others we have stayed in were the bed linens. The bed was very comfy but it did not have the updated linens with large pillows and fluffy down comforter. But the niceness of the hotel more than made up for it. We would highly recommend this hotel. It is a couple of blocks from all the great restaurants and shops. We walked to dinner and back with no problem. The city is beautiful as it was lit up for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Race weekend”
Reviews.Author: NarcoosseeNimrod
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the downtown Marriott for three nights over the Memorial Day/Indianapolis 500 weekend. This was my first trip to Indianapolis. I arrived to the hotel around midnight after a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport that set me back $25+tip. I had no problems at check in. Despite the hour, there were three Marriott staff behind the desk ready to assist us. This high level of staffing was evident throughout the entire weekend. In addition to the front desk and concierge, there were typically four or five staff members floating around the lobby during my entire stay, regardless of the hour. I’m sure this is not typical. The five IRL show cars in the lobby were a nice touch. My room on the 8th floor was well appointed, but not overly spacious. The bathroom was large, but was lacking a vent fan. Be sure to leave the bathroom door open if you don’t want to fog your mirrors. I didn’t have washcloths in my room when I first arrived, but I didn’t make a fuss out of it either. Washcloths were provided when room service cleaned the room on the next two days. Hot water was plentiful and the pressure was good, though the pressure varied slightly during two of my 3 showers. The shower head was adjustable so I’m sure I could have resolved any pressure issue, if there was one. The television in my room was large (maybe 32”) but had small traces of static on some channels. The beds were a little stiffer than my liking and by the third night I was looking forward to my pillow-top back home. I did enjoy the turn down service that was provided without request. It was a hot weekend and I tried to push the room’s AC a little. I set it in the low sixties but it never quite got down there, hovering around seventy for my entire stay. The location of the hotel was good. Indianapolis has a very walkable downtown and the hotel is just a block or two away from a wide variety of restaurants and bars, and three or four blocks from several clubs. Just a short walk west of the hotel is some nice green space and some great paths for joggers, runners, and bikers. I didn’t dine at any of the hotel’s restaurants, but bellied up to the bar in Champions one afternoon for a few drinks. There was not a lot of selection on draft. The view from my room was to the east, and directly faced another hotel. Peering around to the south provided me with a view of the RCA dome. The Conseco Fieldhouse is a 10-15 minute walk to the east. Upon returning from the race on Sunday the hotel had a nicely displayed cookie display in the lobby, with a note saying “Thanks for visiting.” I grabbed a few sugar cookies and headed over to a computer set up by the concierge to check in online for my flight out the following morning. The main page had direct links to all the airline website check-in pages. This was a nice service and worked flawlessly. A pre-5am checkout was no problem and there were multiple cabs at the stand available for the trip back to the airport. It was an enjoyable weekend and the good folks at the Marriott downtown really put their best foot forward.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have our guests stay at this hotel when they visit our business. We have always been pleased with the service and cleanliness. Never have had a poor experience. The lobby/bar area is small and not very private so business discussions are uncomfortable because of the lack of privacy. All in all we are very pleased with hotel and the value it provides.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Because this was simply a pleasure trip for me and my two daughters, I called ahead to find out what size their pool was. I was told it was an olympic size pool which turned out not to be true. There was a bug in our room and the walk to the "attached" Circle Centre Mall was a long one, even though you can get there through the a large convention center and several sky walks. This place is big and if that makes you happy then great but it seemed there was wasted space and the hallways were long. It just didn't have that special luxury feel you get at the Radisson or Hyatt. The Hyatt is right next to the mall and offers so much more for about the same price. I would never stay at this Marriott again. Also, the soaps and shampoos are all heavily scented so be sure to bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was a typical hotel room. Not very large. Bathroom was nice and big. The beds were not very good. One was as hard as a rock and one was too soft. The hotel is in a great location next to convention center and RCA Dome and one block from mall. The staff was extremely friendly. Booked this room on Priceline. Got a good deal so can't complain. It was great for the price.
